Product Title: The Great Outdoors [DVD]
Review Date: 2013/06/10
Store: Dan Aykroyd  (Actor),     John Candy  (Actor),     Howard Deutch  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Action & Adventure
Product Description: ['When an unannounced, uninvited and unwelcome family of fun-loving misfits converge upon a lakeside resort to join their relatives for a summer of relaxation, the result is anything but restful in this raucous comedy starring Dan Aykroyd and John Candy.It\'s a vacationer\'s worst nightmare, as wheeler-dealer Aykroyd, his sexually repressed wife and eerie twin daughters "join" the easygoing Candy and his straight-laced clan for a season of "fun" in the sun. Unfortunately, the only thing these two in-laws have in common is their intense dislike for each other. Soon, it\'s brother-in-law against brother-in-law in an uproarious and hilarious fight to the finish to see which one really knows how to enjoy The Great Outdoors.', 'Bonus Content:', 'Production Notes', 'Production Notes', 'Cast and Filmmakers', 'Cast and Filmmakers', 'Theatrical Trailer', 'Theatrical Trailer', ']]>']
Average Rating: 4.8

The Triplets of Belleville
Sylvain Chomet  (Director)    Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, Sony Pictures Classics, Comedy
["You've never seen anything like", 'The Triplets of Belleville', ', a wildly inventive and highly original animated feature crowded with colorful characters and fantastic imagery. Kidnapped by mysterious, square-shouldered henchmen, a Tour de France cyclist named Champion is spirited across the ocean to the teeming metropolis of Belleville. His grandmother and faithful dog follow his trail and are taken in by a trio of eccentric jazz-era divas. The motley sleuths follow the clues to an Underground betting parlor and now the chase is on! Richly imagined, wildly inventive and acclaimed as one of the best films of the year, "', 'Triplets', 'is terrific!" - Richard Corliss, TIME MAGAZINE.']

Pussycat Dolls: Dancer's Body Workout
Robin Antin  (Actor),     Andrea Ambandos  (Director)    Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Exercise & Fitness
["Pussycat Dolls creator Robin Antin specially designed this workout to bring out your sexy side while working your whole body. You'll learn to move with confidence as you dance your way to into show-stopping shape. With a soundtrack of hit Pussycat Dolls songs that are guaranteed to keep you energized, this fun and fierce workout uses signature PCD moves to help burn fat, build muscle, and create the lean, toned body of a dancer. Inside every woman is a pussycat doll just waiting to come out. Unleash Yours!Feature Dance Segments:-When I Grow Up-Wait A Minute-Burlesque-Style Chair DanceBONUS! The Purrfect 4-Minute Workout:A quick but effective routine that fits into any schedule."]

Deadwood: The Complete Series
Ian McShane  (Actor),     Timothy Olyphant  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Drama
['Product Description', 'Deadwood: The Complete Series (DVD)', 'The Black Hills of South Dakota. Witness the birth of an American frontier town - and the ruthless power struggle between its just and unjust pioneers.', ']]>', 'Amazon.com', 'Deadwood', 'represents one of those periodic, wholesale reinventions of the Western that is as different from, say,', 'Lonesome Dove', "as that miniseries is from Howard Hawks's", 'Rio Bravo', "or the latter is from Anthony Mann's", 'The Naked Spur', ". In many ways, HBO's", 'Deadwood', "embraces the Western's unambiguous morality during the cinema's silent era through the 1930s while also blazing trails through a post-", 'NYPD Blue', ', post-', 'The West Wing', 'television age exalting dense and customized dialogue. On top of that,', 'Deadwood', "has managed an original look and texture for a familiar genre: gritty, chaotic, and surging with both dark and hopeful energy. Yet the show's creator, erstwhile", 'NYPD Blue', 'head writer David Milch, never ridicules or condescends to his more grasping, futile characters or overstates the virtues of his heroic ones.', 'Set in an ungoverned stretch of South Dakota soon after the 1876 Custer massacre,', 'Deadwood', "concerns a lawless, evolving town attracting fortune-seekers, drifters, tyrants, and burned-out adventurers searching for a card game and a place to die. Others, particularly women trapped in prostitution, sundry do-gooders, and hangers-on have nowhere else to go. Into this pool of aspiration and nightmare arrive former Montana lawman Seth Bullock (Timothy Olyphant) and his friend Sol Starr (John Hawkes), determined to open a lucrative hardware business. Over time, their paths cross with a weary but still formidable Wild Bill Hickok (Keith Carradine) and his doting companion, the coarse angel Calamity Jane (Robin Weigert); an aristocratic, drug-addicted widow (Molly Parker) trying to salvage a gold mining claim; and a despondent hooker (Paula Malcomson) who cares, briefly, for an orphaned girl. Casting a giant shadow over all is a blood-soaked king, Gem Saloon owner Al Swearengen (Ian McShane), possibly the best, most complex, and mesmerizing villain seen on TV in years. Each of these characters, and many others, will forge alliances and feuds, cope with disasters (such as smallpox), and move--almost invisibly but inexorably--toward some semblance of order and common cause. Making it all worthwhile is Milch's masterful dialogue--often profane, sometimes courtly and civilized, never perfunctory--and the brilliant acting of the aforementioned performers plus others.", '--Tom Keogh']

profile:
**User Summary:**

This user continues to showcase a strong preference for classic horror films, particularly those with a distinctive stylistic approach from directors like Tim Burton. Their admiration for Johnny Depp highlights their appreciation for eclectic performances that intertwine fantasy and horror. Recently, they have embraced family-friendly holiday films, reflecting a love for feel-good classics that evoke nostalgia, especially cherished during the Christmas season.

In a notable evolution of their interests, the user is increasingly drawn to high-quality television series featuring complex storytelling and character development, underscoring their interest in acclaimed dramas. Additionally, their recent purchase of a beloved comedy featuring iconic actors indicates a growing appreciation for lighthearted, family-oriented entertainment. This aligns with their affinity for films that resonate with warm familial connections.

The user's engagement with exercise routines, particularly those incorporating dance elements, continues to exhibit their openness to activities that blend enjoyment with physical wellness. Their consistent feedback on purchasing experiences showcases a commitment to curating a diverse personal collection across genres, with a sustained focus on horror. Overall, the user embodies a well-rounded appreciation for cinema and television, continuously enriching their experiences with joyful films and holistic well-being initiatives.
